Sentece: Application of a total of 19 mg/kg BH4 intravenously (i.v.) over 3 hours led to a dose-dependent increase in serum cGMP concentrations from a median 3.3 nM (interquartile range [IQR] 1.1-5.6) to 5.7 nM (IQR 2.4-13.3, p=0.008) and NOx from a median 49.3 microM (IQR 39.8-56.6) to 59.7 microM (39.6-85.5) (p=0.058).
Title: Effects of tetrahydrobiopterin on nitric oxide bioavailability and renal hemodynamics in healthy volunteers.
Name: Nitroarginine

Sentece: Indomethacin (1.5 mg x kg(-1) i.m.) abolished the NO-donor potentiation of the GH response induced by Hexarelin in both young dogs (1,627.25 +/- 260.90 v 1,163.37 +/- 334.84 ng x mL(-1) x h, P < .05) and old dogs (1,061.47 +/- 210.38 v 365.69 +/- 79.27 ng x mL(-1) x h, P < .01) without affecting the plasma GH peak evoked by the peptide alone (young dogs, 786.04 +/- 153.44 v 960.04 +/- 444.44 ng x mL(-1) x h, P = NS; old dogs, 474.55 +/- 47.30 v 490.82 +/- 144.86 ng x mL(-1) x h, P = NS).

Title: Nitric oxide modulation of the growth hormone-releasing activity of Hexarelin in young and old dogs.

Sentece: Indomethacin (1.5 mg x kg(-1) i.m.) abolished the NO-donor potentiation of the GH response induced by Hexarelin in both young dogs (1,627.25 +/- 260.90 v 1,163.37 +/- 334.84 ng x mL(-1) x h, P < .05) and old dogs (1,061.47 +/- 210.38 v 365.69 +/- 79.27 ng x mL(-1) x h, P < .01) without affecting the plasma GH peak evoked by the peptide alone (young dogs, 786.04 +/- 153.44 v 960.04 +/- 444.44 ng x mL(-1) x h, P = NS; old dogs, 474.55 +/- 47.30 v 490.82 +/- 144.86 ng x mL(-1) x h, P = NS).
Title: Nitric oxide modulation of the growth hormone-releasing activity of Hexarelin in young and old dogs.
Name: Nitroarginine

Sentece: The CD50 value for aminophylline-induced clonus and tonus/ mortality was decreased from 233 to 191 and from 242 to 212 mg/kg, respectively.
Title: NG-nitro-L-arginine, a nitric oxide synthase inhibitor, and seizure susceptibility in four seizure models in mice.

Sentece: Ethanol at a dose of 4 g/kg, i.p. induced sleep in rats (sleep time: 117.2+/-30.7 min).
Title: The effects of the nitric oxide synthase inhibitor 7-nitroindazole on ethanol pharmacokinetics in rats after acute and chronic ethanol administration.
Name: Nitroarginine

Sentece: Continuous intravenous infusion of 1 mg x kg(-1) x h(-1) of L-NAME for 12 h in patients with septic shock increased blood pressure and resulted in increasing plasma concentrations of L-NOARG (Cmax 6.2 microg x ml(-1) at 12 h) whereas L-NAME concentrations reached a plateau within 1.5 h (Cmax 1.0 microg x ml(-1)).
Title: Distribution and metabolism of N(G)-nitro-L-arginine methyl ester in patients with septic shock.
Name: Nitroarginine

Sentece: Continuous intravenous infusion of 1 mg x kg(-1) x h(-1) of L-NAME for 12 h in patients with septic shock increased blood pressure and resulted in increasing plasma concentrations of L-NOARG (Cmax 6.2 microg x ml(-1) at 12 h) whereas L-NAME concentrations reached a plateau within 1.5 h (Cmax 1.0 microg x ml(-1)).
Title: Distribution and metabolism of N(G)-nitro-L-arginine methyl ester in patients with septic shock.
Name: Nitroarginine

Sentece: After the infusion was stopped L-NAME disappeared from the plasma rapidly (half-life 19.2 min) whereas L-NOARG concentration declined slowly (half-life 22.9 h).
Title: Distribution and metabolism of N(G)-nitro-L-arginine methyl ester in patients with septic shock.
Name: Nitroarginine

Sentece: After the infusion was stopped L-NAME disappeared from the plasma rapidly (half-life 19.2 min) whereas L-NOARG concentration declined slowly (half-life 22.9 h).
Title: Distribution and metabolism of N(G)-nitro-L-arginine methyl ester in patients with septic shock.
Name: Nitroarginine

Sentece: The calculated volume of distribution for L-NAME was 0.451 x kg(-1) body weight and 1.961 x kg(-1) for L-NOARG.
Title: Distribution and metabolism of N(G)-nitro-L-arginine methyl ester in patients with septic shock.
Name: Nitroarginine
